Info.title: AIRR Data File
Info.description: AIRR Data File written by AIRR Standards Python Library

study.study_title: Wen et al., Immune cell profiling of COVID-19 patients in the recovery stage by single-cell sequencing
study.study_description: An inflammatory immune signature in the early recovery stage of COVID-19 suggests patients are still vulnerable after hospital discharge.
study.grants: National Natural Science Foundation of China, award number 81722034, 81670015, 81830054, 81530028, 91953122, 31871326, 81721003, 81988101; Ministry of Science and Technology Key Program, award number 2018ZX09101002, 2017ZX100203205; Shanghai Pujiang Program, award number 2019PJD059; Guangdong Natural Science Funds for Distinguished Young Scholar, award number 2016A030306006, 2020B1515020057
study.lab_name: National Center for Liver Cancer, Second Military Medical University
study.lab_address: Second Military Medical University, 200438 Shanghai, China

sample.collection_time_point_reference: Less than N days after first negative COVID-19 test
sample.tissue_processing: PBMCs isolated from heparinized venous blood using Ficoll-Hypaque density solution; cell viability exceeded 80%
sample.library_generation_protocol: Single-cell suspensions of samples were converted to barcoded scRNA-seq libraries using the Chromium Single Cell 5ÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂ² Library and Gel Bead Kit v2 (PN-120237), Multiplex Kit, and Chip Kit (10x Genomics). Full-length TCR/BCR V(D)J segments were enriched from amplified cDNA from 5ÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂ² libraries via PCR amplification using a Chromium Single-Cell V(D)J Enrichment kit (10x Genomics) according to the manufacturerÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢s protocol.
